title: Front Brake Pads - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning

body.name: Front brake pad anti rattle spring_TP0178

body.body: Make sure the brake pad anti rattle spring is located with the arrow following wheel rotation and the curve positioned below the retaining pin.
Fit the brake pad retaining pin:
Position the brake pad retaining pin through the outer hole of the brake caliper,
Push the brake pad retaining pin through the hole in the outer brake pad,
Apply finger pressure to the anti rattle spring and push the brake pad retaining pin over it,
Push the brake pad retaining pin through the hole in the inner brake pad,
Continue pushing the brake pad retaining pin until it is seated in the inner hole of the brake caliper.
Tighten the brake pad retaining pin to
Fit the spring clip between the threaded part of the brake pad retaining pin and the outer face of the outer brake pad.
It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes.
The fault must be checked and rectified by a competent person with the specialist knowledge and technical understanding of motorcycles, such as an authorised Triumph dealer.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Pump the brake lever to correctly position the caliper pistons.

Use only DOT 4 specification brake fluid as listed in the General Information section of this manual. The use of brake fluids other than those DOT 4 fluids listed in the General Information section may reduce the efficiency of the braking system leading to an accident. Observe the brake fluid handling warnings given in the general information section (see
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Check the front brake fluid level and top up as required with new DOT 4 fluid.
